      • generatePrimaryStage

        public javafx.stage.Stage generatePrimaryStage()
        Generates the primary stage for the game, setting up the window stage and creates the node groups for managing game sprites. It also sets up fov, the camera uses to create a sense of 3D perspective (stars float by slower when moving than other units)
        Returns:
        The primary stage window

      • generateStoryWorld

        public void generateStoryWorld()
        Generates the story world by setting world h and w and adding random planet and asteroid clusters. Used for testing purposes only as the final product should be all pre-defined planets and clusters

      • showMap

        public void showMap(game.World world)
        Generates the minimap window, showing a scaled down representation of all discovered objects in the game world, and returns the Stage to be opened with show()
        Parameters:
        world - Which world the map should be shown for

      • newCourseWindow

        public javafx.stage.Stage newCourseWindow()
        Generates the window used for setting a new ship course, consisting of a slider that the uses to pick a heading, a text box to manually enter a heading, a button that closes the window and set the course on the desired heading
        Returns:
        the new course window

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove(location.Location destination)
        Runs when the player is ordered to move. When the player movement TranslateTransistion animation is run, a similar animation is run in the opposite direction for the same distance and same time on the worldGroup, the group containing all visible game nodes including the player.
        With the entire universe moving backwards as the player is moving forward, it appears to the user the player is stationary in the middle of the screen (the 'camera' stays focused on the player).
        This method signature is used for long distance travel, such as when the user enters a heading and the player keeps moving until a new heading is set or short-distance mouse travel is used. For its varient used for short-distance mouse travel, use playerMove(double,double).
        Parameters:
        destination - Location of where the player is moving toward
        See Also:
        playerMove(double,double)

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove(double screenX,
                       double screenY)
        Same as playerMove(Location) except instead of passing a Location parameter two doubles are passed, the x and y coordinates that the player clicked (used for short-distance, mouse click travel)
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x coordinate of where the user clicked on screen
        screenY - The y coordinate of where the user clicked on screen
        See Also:
        playerMove(Location)

      • howMuch

        public javafx.stage.Stage howMuch(java.lang.String prompt,
                                  int max,
                                  int min)
        Generates a window with the passed prompt String asking the user to select a number between the passed min and max values.
        Parameters:
        prompt - What the window asks
        max - Max slider value
        min - Min slider value
        Returns:
        the user-selected number
